thread.title: Stripling, Thigpen break down Vols' South Florida newcomers
thread.title_full: Stripling, Thigpen break down Vols' South Florida newcomers

title: Stripling, Thigpen break down Vols' South Florida newcomers
text:
Stripling, Thigpen break down Vols' South Florida newcomers Stripling, Thigpen break down Vols' South Florida newcomers as National Signing Day arrives Slot to Tennessee Links (Photo: Ryan Callahan, 247Sports) 
When the school record-holder for most career sacks, a record set in a scant three years, is among the defensive linemen gone from a program, replacing that production as soon as possible becomes paramount. 
Thus, Tennessee defensive line coach Steve Stripling --- whose contract at UT expires at the end of this month --- raved about having South Florida native and 247Sports three-star DeAndre Johnson already on campus as UT launched its National Signing Day show hosted by Voice of the Titans, Mike Keith. 
“We’re excited about having Deandre here,” said Stripling. “He’s a fantastic young man, and it’s a real benefit of getting him early. We’ll start what we call skill development soon.” 
(What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) Johnson, aside from adding strength and knowledge for the college game, also is gearing up to add weight, Stripling explained as he also noted Johnson’s strong high school program at Miami Southridge. 
“He comes from a championship program, a real stingy defense,” Stripling continued. “He played inside and outside, very versatile. We’re excited about his growth potential. 
“We would like most of our ends to get to about 250, 260. I think Derek (Barnett) was in the 260s most of his career.” 
Johnson wasn’t the only newcomer being touted by Vols’ coaches as UT’s NSD special got underway. Linebackers coach Tommy Thigpen offered some of his first comments on athletic ‘backer Shanon Reid . 
“We looked at him on tape and thought he was the best outside linebacker in the state of Florida,” Thigpen said. “This kid has played linebacker, knows the position, has all the intangibles.” Author
